alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:17PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern San Miguel and western Montrose Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 616 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an areas of strong thunderstorms near Nucla, Bedrock, and Naturita moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern San Miguel and western Montrose Counties, including the following locations... Escalante Forks, Redvale, Bedrock, Vancorum and Uravan. This includes the following highways... Colorado 90 between mile markers 12 and 33. Colorado 141 between mile markers 33 and 38, and between mile markers 40 and 81. Colorado 145 between mile markers 100 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
